header.rec_loc: In a newly-opened bistro in Tarnow, Poland
header.topics: The newly-opened bistro, addiction, identity, dreams, fitness, friendships, shops, periods.
header.activity: Two friends talking about various topics (see 9 above) in a newly-opened bistro in Tarnow, Poland.

speaker.occupation: unemployed/ Some part-time private TEFL teacher/ Semi-retired
Teacher of English as a foreign Language

body.u: oh hello
so right so yes anyway talking about erm yeah coffee

but I think places like this in this part of Poland I just get the impression they spend a lot of their money on the design and all this that and the other but no one comes either because they don't know it's here mm and I just think eating out in general is not a thing done by people unless they have loads and loads of money and if you had loads and loads of money you wouldn't come here and I don't think it's very close to schools either so I I imagine it would attract lots of teenagers but I don't know where the nearest school is
mm mm yeah yeah it is next door to Lidl's car park so they might get
yeah with parking facilities definitely
yeah they might get the
people wandering in

yeah I mean I would pop in for a coffee when I'm Lidling and actually I would be really happy to meet you here if you fancied a coffee I just hope the next one is not in a paper cup that's a little bit disappointing when everything else is so nice and nice fit out nice design nice coffee
yeah isn't it? really nice we could have our own cups
yeah yeah we could do you could just buy one in Lidl
yeah well I was going to say keep them behind the bar
a pound's worth of mug just pop it in there it would good
we could write our names on them

yeah my friend he lives near Brisbane in Australia he's erm his local coffee shop has his cup there and when he he sits there and passes the time of day with them the morning drinking his morning coffee and when he's finished he goes round the back and washes it up ready for tomorrow

that's nice that's nice and puts it yeah when I work in we always have cups and we have got to write our names on them because otherwise people you know will start using each other's cups so we started doing it with pen permanent pen and it would just wash off you know you just er rub it off with your finger and use the cup so then we did it with nail varnish and that was slightly more effective
that doesn't last though does it? yeah yeah okay oh that's a good hint
yeah write your name on it in nail varnish
so nail varnish survives the washing up?
but I would still just use someone else's cup anyway
yeah
I don't think it matters yes so confession time a strange confession
mm yeah
I think I need to tell somebody
okay that's your Catholic upbringing

but for the last or two or so years I've had this weird addiction to this medication and I've decided to stop taking this medication it's not a physical addiction in that there's nothing chemically inside this medication that makes you need to take it it's like a psychological addiction to it where if you it's basically to do with like decongestion and noses and it's one of these things where the more you take it when you stop using it the more the symptoms the original symptoms are worse so it gets worse and worse and it's been like two years and I imagine it's what it's like if you start taking loads and loads of drugs like the inside of your nose is sore it's bleeding to the point where it scratches
mm mm uhu right okay cold relief okay yeah okay yeah you've got that now?
yeah
oh okay
and I'm starting to think eventually my nose is just going to like fall off
fall off so you might think okay yeah so you're going to look like you're a a coke head
yeah a coke addict yeah
like a big hole in it or something yeah okay
so you know which is why me and went to buy that sort of nose inside nose washer
oh you didn't go and get it?
no we did we did
oh you did okay

and I'm hoping that with a mixture of that and sort of willpower I will be able to break this habit but I was googling it I've googled it in the past I googled it again today and it's like loads of people are saying I've been addicted to this for ten years
mm yeah oh wow well if people have been addicted for ten years presumably their noses haven't fallen off
they are still attached to their face
yeah

but I'm just trying to break this habit so it's really awful because it means that I can't breathe through my nose until I learn to breathe again without relying on medication to help me breathe so it's just going to be
yeah oh no okay the people on this site said how long it's taken before their nose gets back to normal?

they are saying like a few weeks but people are sort of going on it the people who are writing on this forum that when they start and I sort of think if they are not writing about it sort of weeks later then it must be because it's a positive because you would only write about something if it's negative
yeah mm yeah if it's yeah if it's a problem yeah
yeah so I'm hoping that in a couple of weeks
yeah that you will be alright again
yeah
that's cool
so it's rubbish

in the meantime yeah that saline stuff probably wouldn't hurt and also steam baths sticking your head over a bowl of hot water with a towel possibly with some baking soda or salty stuff Epsom salts I don't know can you breathe them in?
yeah mm mm yeah yeah yeah yeah we've had salts yeah they had something like really you know like menthol like type things
well Vicks is good but by god it makes you blind if you are not careful if you accidentally open your eyes when you are breathing it in
yeah so I'm just I'm hoping that sort of fresh air and being distracted and I think something like that will help it's worse at night but
yeah yeah well good for you my god you are a woman on a mission you are really clearing out everything that's toxic in your life aren't you? it's like tick next
yeah I know I know and I feel like if I do it all at the same time I'm just going to implode the lot
yeah booze yeah man yeah nasal stuff yeah
the inside of my brain
what's next?
yeah I know
yeah good for you though just I suppose new year new beginnings it's erm yeah I mean you can recreate yourself at any time
yeah exactly

yeah I was listening to last Sunday's Johnnie Walker's Sounds of the Seventies when I was cooking this morning and it was really interesting the first hour was dedicated to David Bowie and there were interviews with him sort of talking about inventing himself and becoming the character and things like that which I thought was just really interesting and quite wonderful and it sounds like he got a bit confused at some times as to whether he really was that character which of course he was if he was acting the role then of course he was but I suppose equally it sort of opens up for all of us the idea that we can be whoever we want to be and we can perform a role in life that we want to perform be the character we want to be so there's nothing false about it it's just do it

mm mm yeah mm yeah me and my friend have talked about this before where sort of if you're if you are acting for want of a better word erm is it a good thing or a bad thing? and will you eventually become that person who you are acting as? but if you are acting as it then it's because you are already that person
mm yeah yeah you already are yeah it's a bit like people who affect a silly laugh and then after a while that is their laugh it sort of stops becoming ironic and amusing and just becomes
mm yeah your laugh
your laugh that people then take the piss out of because it's amusing so yeah
so I don't know
yeah interesting now I think my view is that as human beings we're dynamic changing evolving there is no this is me it's you know you are as you are in the moment so be who you wanna be man you know
yeah mm we shall see anyway anyway anyway I'm just a bit er at the moment but I'm trying to stay I'm positive I am positive about the future but it is just like
are you positive about now?
I am I am positive about now
that'll do
an and in terms of the future I'm kind of thinking god do I have to do all of these things all of the time? it's so exhausting
no you don't you just do it now
yeah just do it now don't think about it
exactly just do it now yeah
that's good yes

yeah the future doesn't really exist anyway so yeah yeah I've been struggling again with not being on alcohol and I'm almost desperate for January to end so I can have some alcohol but it's kind of I'm a bit concerned really it's highlighted to me that perhaps there's a deeper issue there and I'm starting to feel I think I said to you the other day that something changed something clicked in me a few days ago and I feel like a whole different person and that's carrying on and I really do I'm getting more energy now I'm starting to feel really good and I wonder if part of that is detoxing
mm mm yeah well yes and what's the date today? it's like what the twenty-third?
twenty-se twenty-third it's my nephew's birthday
yeah so it's twenty-one days to break a habit
is it?
possibly or twenty-eight
or a hundred and two I don't know
oh I meant to send you those
twenty-one days to break a habit I'm sure that's true

Abraham-Hicks thing on Facebook the other day basically saying people say it takes thirty days twenty-eight days twenty-one days whatever to break a habit but actually it only takes a moment because there's only now so you have broken it now erm yeah I was going to send that to you I forgot I might have photographed it actually let's see if I can show you that without bollocksing up the recording let's have a look oh yeah it's still recording that's good okay camera roll yeah I did here are look oh no that's not the one okay is it that one? no it's not that one no
he's got a lot of interesting things to say
no no I didn't save it to my phone
yeah mm yeah well if this twenty-one day thing is true then you know you by now we should be feeling the positive effects

yeah but you know I do wonder if I've got about the psychological addiction because it's not really a physical addiction anymore because after a few weeks it's sort of out of my system so it's only psychological addiction I'm thinking now maybe I need to not drink in February as well but then I think well let's have a really big binge on the first of February but then I would probably be pissed on half a shandy so we will see

yeah yeah yes I used to think or I used to do when I was at uni kind of I wouldn't drink really very much at all for a few weeks or a few months and then have a massive binge and realise why I wasn't drinking
mm yeah but then you can stop again
it's like a second wind oh yeah there's another month erm I could easily do another month not drinking just because I don't think anything good comes of it erm
yeah yeah mm yeah

because then I'm relying so heavily on some of the negative experiences at the end of December I'm just you know you are using them to my advantage which is why I don't want that to happen again I don't want to be that oh yeah I don't want yeah
mm yeah you don't want to be mm
well no it's not that I don't want to be that person because that's putting it on me and I don't think it's me
mm well you still have a role to play in any situation
yeah yeah
so in some form if not in the physical world then at least in some sort of vibrational level you've invited a challenge at some level
uhu yeah yeah so

and in a way if you think about how good you are feeling now maybe you can I don't know maybe it will take a bit longer but at some point you might be able to look back on December and say oh my god best thing that ever happened
thank you it changed yeah it changed something
yeah yeah that's really cool
yeah yeah yeah so but it is I think not drinking because we've been talking about barriers so much not drinking puts a huge barrier around you in some ways erm
mm how much of that is real and how much of that is psychological?
I don't know in terms of people don't well certain people especially don't want anything to do with you
mm you don't get invited to parties or

yeah or yeah at the same time you don't want to go to parties sometimes because it will be more miserable or you enjoy yourself you don't want to bring other people down I don't know it's kind of a combination of things

yeah yeah I really struggled when we went bowling I felt so boring that's why I went home when you all went on to play pool in town but I realised that you know I think that was just where I was at at the time and part of the detox process possibly I'm quite capable of carrying a party head on dancing the night away and being stone-cold sober but in that moment I wasn't so I don't know I do wonder if a big bit of me kind of reaches the point where I think no I'm not really into this scene anymore you know at some point somebody always arrives with a tray of shots and that sometimes leads to another tray of shots and there have been times in my life when that's a fantastic thing keep it rolling let's go yeah yeah yeah but for the most part I kind of think actually no I don't want to be in that scene yeah it's not such fun I don't know I kind of think drugs are better from that viewpoint because you don't have a stinking hangover in the morning
yeah yeah yeah no I don't
yeah

I could keep this up for another month just because I've really sort of riding this wave of everything is okay and especially because we are on holiday as well it's sort of helped I thought it would be rubbish being on holiday and not being able to drink but actually it's been a bit of a godsend in a way because you can do things
yeah yeah you can get out for a walk you can get to the gym
yeah your days are so much longer because erm you are not I don't know lying in bed hungover or you've got the energy to get up in the morning
yeah yeah yeah you can enjoy the daylight enjoy the fresh air go out for a day trip

yeah and we've done we've done so much I mean I'm not saying if we had er if I had been on loads of nights out that wouldn't have happened it would have just happened but I would have you know been drinking the next day to to keep my spirits up or whatever
yeah mm yeah and perhaps on a teaching week you'd be more likely to be out on a Friday night or out on a Saturday night or even out on a Thursday night so yeah
yeah yeah so it's nice
it's kind of taken the pressure off Thursday Friday Saturday eve for not being drinking nights
I thought today was Monday
because we meet up in the week
yeah
yeah that's true I need to remember it is Saturday for the bus timetable
I have no idea what's going on at all

oh shit I've done that before oh that was just after New Year when I was back and I walked into town and was waiting for this bus back and it was like minus seventeen or something ridiculous and I had been at this bus stop and I thought oh thank god only five minutes to the bus and I waited and waited and waited and waited and then I realised fuck it's Saturday and it was more than half an hour oh no I'm never ever doing that again so I'm quite yeah remember to look what day it is
oh my god oh yeah

but no feeling good and I keep having these dreams last night's dream was wonderful and I quite often dream about buildings or houses and I'm exploring them or I'm renovating them and I look on these as part of my psyche or different aspects of self and the dream I'm also having lots of kitten dreams I told you about that
mm yeah yeah you said yeah

which I think is sort of my higher self saying it's time to have some fun because I associate kittens with fun and laying on the ground and rolling around on the floor and playing basically so there's I feel like I feel a lot more light-hearted than I've felt in a while so I'm feeling a bit more kittenish but I think I probably am attracting kittens as well so I expect some cats to be arriving soon little cats but yeah so a couple of nights ago I had this dream and I was kind of in this big mansion and at the top of the hallway and it was mine my friend was painting and she had done this purpley turquoise colour which is impossible but it's possible in dreamland and she had painted a bit over the white ceiling oh fuck she's gone over the line never mind I will do that again when she's gone home when it's dried and then opposite that I was doing a turquoisey colour and there was a mirror there and I had friends around all helping which was really nice but it just felt really warm homely the mirror was reflecting the light and it was great and this one last night I was in this massive mansion again and it was really old fashioned with old fashioned sofas and things and I went into a room I'd never been in before and opened all of the massive dusty curtains and it was a big high ceiling room there were windows all about so I was letting light in again so I think this is all quite symbolic and there was a guy on the outside riding his bike and with every sort of second foot it went on the bike so I knew he was there and I felt a bit threatened by him but it was almost like well I need to take the risk if I'm to let light in that there might be some nastiness out there but you know I can see it all and it's only my perception that there might be nastiness maybe it will maybe it won't who knows? and a friend of mine was with me there as well and she's actually a painter and decorator for a living so there's almost that sort of freshening up renovating sort of theme going on again so that's two dreams with painting and decorating and renovating light letting light in in kind of the darkened rooms of my psyche so bring it on
yeah yeah yeah uhu that was nice yeah uhu yeah no yeah uhu very nice good good good keep clearing out keep changing keep renovating

yeah and physically I had a bloody good clear out yesterday with you know everybody has got that junk drawer well I've I've got junk shoe boxes and the junk wooden box and I cleared all of those out yesterday and just got two metal box things to go and that's all of the real junk junk tackled so I'm going to do that today
oh easy-peasy yeah yes I'm feeling good
hey
yeah just happy happy
that's good
yeah with a it's a sort of leading quite a simple life at the moment but it's quite nice
simple is good as well
you don't need to be doing and drinking and
but you aren't doing
yeah
because you are gyming
yeah man
are you walking?
I had a lovely gym this morning it was so nice
good what did you do this morning?

I'm just trying to work out what is really the best thing to do if I've got this man for two hours a week and it's really sort of intense heavy stuff that takes up time to recover and some time to sort of build up to I don't want to be doing too much sort of lifting stuff on my own
mm mm yeah you need more aerobic stuff than to stretch you out
yeah so I was just doing lots of yeah cycling and climbing endless stairs climbing and climbing and then lots of stretching as well because I haven't sort of been stretching since before summer
mm stretching is amazing I love stretching

yeah and I hate it's been miserable no it doesn't make me miserable I'm not very good at it so I need to practise practise and practise it's one of those sort of things where your body really responds to it quite quickly but you have to do it you have to do it a lot or otherwise your body won't learn

mm yeah and breathe I think stretching in particular breath is so very important yeah they say that in yoga if your body is struggling your natural instinct is to hold your breath but what you really need to breathe through breathe deeply through it yeah
yeah you need to breathe through yes
yeah don't forget to breathe it sounds so stupid but people just do yeah
uhu yeah so it's been nice and I've been listening to podcasts and stuff while I'm cycling away it's really nice
good
to have someone chatting away in my ears
coming in your ears
coming in your ears still so funny

yeah yeah I've had a lot of the Sounds of the Seventies on the radio Iplayer I didn't realise cos I maybe it's my favourite I loved Johnnie Walker I didn't realise there are three that I haven't heard so that's three weeks I haven't been listening to it I thought where have I been? what have I been doing to not listen to it? but so I had a couple last night while I was tidying out the junk shoe boxes and the junk boxes and the one today which was the Bowie one when I was cooking it's just I love it it's and I have realised I was when I walked here today it took me about an hour and a quarter and I was just playing music all the way and really into it music really moves me incredibly so and I think seventies music in particular you know seventies rock disco whatever it might be a bit of ska today as well er a bit of reggae it's just brilliant erm and through my walking as well it just I don't know literally you see you don't really feel like you are exercising you just are on another plain it's just wonderful but it did strike me listening to my Ipod on random I don't seem to have any eighties stuff I don't know why
uhu yeah sort it out
and I like eighties I do like it so I've got seventies and then I've got a little bit of nineties and a lot of noughties mm and a bit of sixties
uhu I was sweating so much this morning I forgot my towel because I put it in the wash after my last workout erm because it was disgusting
oh no have you only got one towel?

yeah only one gym towel that's like that sort of not so big but it you know drowning you I was just really you know dripping down onto the machine you know everything was wet my arms were wet my face er because I sort of had my head down climbing these stairs so I didn't fall over I was just you know when you are sort of breathing and oh just spray sweat everywhere I was just oh that spray I need to go and get some tissue
oh okay yeah yeah oh mm everywhere lovely there's something quite satisfactory about that though quite enjoyable
yeah but it is also this sort of detox you are getting rid of stuff not just getting rid of that's just mainly from my forehead straight out straight everywhere
mm yeah why not? it's all good
is that two o'clock? how has that happened?
ah it's magic it doesn't exist anyway
it does
it doesn't it's now
oh god there's so much to do
the time is now what have you got to do?
I'm kidding I don't have anything to do
there you go don't worry about it it's all good
yes so I don't know not a clue I will text her
yeah well send her a message from my Polish phone what sort of time three?
yeah whenever she is ready I suppose
yeah that's cool and then
I've got no plans until eight
are you hungry?
I'm always hungry

okay so I've got some gnocchi stuff actually out of Lidl and it crossed my mind while I was carrying my heavyish rucksack for an hour and a quarter we are next door to Lidl so yeah it is like a spinach gnocchi and then the pesto funnily enough the cheapest pesto is in Alma cheaper than Tesco's cheaper than Lidl it's probably shit but anyway we will try it it looks good it looks quite thick stuff and then I bought six cloves of garlic with me because we are in Poland so it's the law you have to reek of garlic all the time so we can put one or none or six or any number in between in our lovely gnocchi and I think was going to do a salad and I've bought the stereo thing to plug into your laptop for proper movie sound
I'm lazy oh nice yeah you could have just got it from here oh nice interesting oh nice uhu oh my gosh no uhu uhu oh nice yes and I be able to

if you text her

okay I hate this Polish phone look what ate you up to? and then if I want to go back and replace the T in ate with an R for are I mean that's actually done it quite sensibly but sometimes I'm just clicking at various bits it's because it's cheap plastic shit anyway what are you up to? er I'm with in for frig sake look come on I'm yeah that's just annoying anyway I'm with and it's oh I have to put the apostrophe in oh I will have to fault myself it's nearly film o'clock

well someone is going to get
I think that must be so difficult when you start a business like that
yeah and you've just got to wait and you are so excited for customers and you have put all of your life savings into it

yeah I hope they know it's possibly I think they say erm the first year of a business you make a loss the second year you break even and the third year you make a profit and I observed and who are a Polish couple who erm moved to my arse end of nowhere in Northern Ireland the bottom of the peninsula village and they had successful restaurant business but the way they did it was they were always open seven days a week so you knew if you fancied a coffee or a fry or whatever if you wandered down to the shore you knew they would be open
uhu mm yeah they would be open but that's not good it's not good for them is it?

well no I used to say to as well because they used to work seven days a week and used to say well I didn't come over here to have a holiday you think well you know that's some heck of a work ethic and I think that idea is to make shitloads of money and then come back to Poland as rich people and not work but I'm too much in my now for that and I just imagine you work your arse off for ten years and then drop down dead and you would be looking down on your body going shit I wish I hadn't bothered but anyway
yeah mm I can't do things like that yes but no one has ever said from the deathbed I wish I'd worked harder
I know exactly so
you know they've gone I'd I really I'd wish I'd travelled the world or done this or done that I don't know

can you please bring your laptop? there we are

have all the shit

I've actually got another bottle of wine that's halfway reasonable and I've got a cherry liqueur thing actually I really a fancy a go at that
oh yeah yeah yeah
that's only fifteen percent so I might drink that bottle on the first of February throw up a bit get really sick and then decide
yeah remember why you stopped drinking
yeah so I think out of all of the booze that's the one I fancy the most
why not?

it's a Monday

no I I kind of think now all of my friends here in this country you know good friends don't care if I'm drunk or sober and the ones who want me to get drunk I think if you want me to get drunk then that means that you might not like me as much so why why should I be your friend?
mm uhu I wonder if the ones like you drunk are the ones who maybe have alcohol issues themselves and it's probably not so much about you as about them
yeah yeah that's true that is true yeah if it's because they want to drink
yeah to no offence but you could be anyone

so yes I feel I'm for it

this is
that would be really good to give up?

this is this is the hardest thing this is way harder than giving up alcohol or giving up chocolate or giving up fags or whatever else so this is like because I'm not addicted to anything else I'm not addicted to alcohol or smoking I just do these things because I enjoy them but this is like addiction because I can't breathe and breathing is very important
yeah and not being able to breathe yeah mm it is kind of important
so I just have to breathe through my mouth like a loser

that's what I mean I kind of don't want to either don't want to go to I'm gonna have to start taking this medication for the trip

so I just have to work through it

you've just reminded me of this really passive aggressive guy I met when hostelling around New Zealand he was this arsehole of an arrogant Essex man who was also hostelling his way around New Zealand on this large motorbike and he basically he went to the boss of every hostel and said look I really really really snore so you need to give me my own personal hostel room at the same price as a shared room bed because I'll keep people awake and you will get complaints and I just thought what a dick you know I mean he was kind of dressing it up as I'm concerned about everybody else erm but really he was just wanting something better for nothing he invariably got it so yeah I was thinking
that's funny yeah uhu
yeah I didn't like his vibe so yeah this is weird there's a sort of a bit of heat coming out of this chipboard thing can you feel it?
well there's a radiator
oh it's up there look there's a radiator behind here
I can't feel it because I'm very warm in this sort of
yeah so anyway yeah we'll see but don't don't worry on my account because oh there's
oh hello
because erm I'm quite used to sharing with my brother when we have been places and he can snore for England
uhu I don't yeah I'm really trying but I know that I am at the moment because there's just like stuff going on
do you wake up with a sore throat?
er with a really dry mouth but it's only been one night so far
yeah it will pass yeah good for you though

you know these people on this website said like they only used this sort of medication once a day and tried to wean themself off it or they only used it in one nostril they had to do it that way so it's like
mm yeah are you cold turkey?
so I'm going to try but it has been a few hours so I might sort of die before then
yeah
I just don't want to
I think cold turkey is the way
yeah keeps ringing me oh well
mm yeah
this is something that I need to give up but I don't really know how to approach the giving up the giving up part it is not so easy to give up an actual person
oh I don't know
I can't just you know pour him down the sink
or put him in the bin or give him to a friend until I come back
I can be really black and white about people sometimes and I can just switch off I'm not sure where that comes from self-preservation instinct I suppose

I know no I can it's like I did it before I can switch someone off like a light switch but I'm never very good at sort of telling them I just go cold turkey with people in the sense that I never speak to them and if they text me I don't reply and if they call me I don't answer and when I see them I blank them which is all horrible things that I shouldn't do
yeah yeah why?

well because I don't think it is fair people sometimes need explanations and but I don't I'm not the sort of person I just don't have the capability to say this isn't working I'm not therefore I can't do it no sorry bye

mm maybe yeah mm yeah to my mind this is a situation where selfishness is vitally important and I suppose there is some sort of circumstances or situations where it might be a kindness to the other person or I don't know compassionate thing to have the conversation with them but at other times
yeah yeah you got to do it for yourself

yeah you've got to do it for yourself I find I can sometimes be a little bit aggressive then sometimes which isn't like me and I will tell someone to fuck off if need be but yeah I'm thinking about an ex-friend who a few years ago and I was a little bit the same I was just blanking her for a while we had a huge falling out and I just thought well fuck you and have the space then to look back on the friendship and relationship and just to think actually that's not really healthy for me and I don't want anything to do with that so off you go then

yeah yeah that's what we were saying in the car the other day I want somebody for whom you know after themselves I'm the most important person in their life and that's not this person you know I will never be the most important person in his life er
mm yeah yeah yeah I completely agree I'm in a relationship I want to be adored
I am the centre of your world
yeah I don't mean that in a completely self-centred way
yeah no no neither do I
but I just want somebody to really value and appreciate me and if they don't really value and appreciate me you know like you say as well as having their own life and their own interests
yes yeah everyone is you should be the centre of your own world you should be the most important person
